abstract: Virginia commonwealth attorney Ray Morrogh decides not to pursue judicial action against police officers who used stun gun on inmate Natasha McKenna, resulting in her death while in Fairfax County jail.
lead_paragraph: The commonwealth’s attorney in Fairfax County, Ray Morrogh, says he will not bring criminal charges against jail deputies who used a stun gun on a restrained inmate who later died.

headline.main: Virginia: No Charges for Deputies in Stun-Gun Death
headline.print_headline: Virginia: No Charges for Deputies in Stun-Gun Death

snippet: The commonwealth’s attorney in Fairfax County, Ray Morrogh, says he will not bring criminal charges against jail deputies who used a stun gun on a restrained inmate who later died.
